text: Attila Horváth (28 July 1967 – 13 November 2020) was a Hungarian discus thrower. He represented Hungary at two Summer Olympics (1992 and 1996). His personal best was 68.58 metres, thrown on 24 June 1994 in Budapest. He was a nine-time national champion in the men's discus event, including eight in a row (1990–1997). He was born in Kőszeg, Hungary. Horváth died on 13 November 2020 from COVID-19 in Szombathely, Hungary at the age of 53. ==References== Category:1967 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Hungary Category:Hungarian athletes Category:Olympians for Hungary Category:Discus throwers
title: Attila Horváth
